title: font-family
description: The `font-family` CSS property specifies the font or list of fonts used for text content within an element.
content: The property that defines the font or list of fonts to be used for text in an element. A specific font, such as 'Roboto' or a generic family, like 'serif' or 'sans-serif', can be specified and the browser will use the first available font in the list.
